frame.name: Obviousness
frame.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Phenomenon</fen> is portrayed with respect to the <fen>Degree</fen> of likelihood that it will be perceived and known, given the (usually implicit) <fen>Evidence</fen>, <fen>Perceiver</fen>, and the <fen>Circumstances</fen> in which it is considered. For several of the LUs, such as <ment>visible, audible, etc.</ment>, the type of the <fen>Evidence</fen> is fixed by the targets themselves being a perceptual experience.
<ex>It<m>'s</m> <fex name="deg">abundantly</fex> <t>obvious</t> <fex name="phe">that we'll need to spend more time on public perception</fex>.</ex> <ex>Are you certain that <fex name="phe">the shovel</fex> <m>was</m> <t>visible</t> <fex name="loc">from the door of the apartment</fex>?</ex> <ex> I think they miss <fex name="phe">some of the important impacts of the work that</fex> <m>are</m> not <t>visible</t> <fex name="evi">just from looking at the vote tally</fex>.</ex> <ex><fex name="phe">That the defense will declare a mistrial regardless</fex> <m>is</m> <fex name="deg">quite</fex> <t>evident</t> <fex name="evi">from their consistent obstructionist tactics</fex>.</ex> <ex><fex name="tim">In late July 2000</fex> <fex name="phe">it</fex> <m>was</m> <fex name="deg">barely</fex> <t>visible</t> <fex name="per">to the unaided eye</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Phenomenon
FE.definition:
<def-root>The entity or facts that are undeniable given the <fen>Evidence</fen>.
<ex>It is <t>obvious</t> for example <fex name="phe">that 9/10 is not the same as 1</fex>.</ex>
</def-root>

FE.name: Attribute
FE.definition: <def-root>The gradable aspect of a <fen>Phenomenon</fen> which concerns how likely it is that the <fen>Phenomenon</fen> be known. This frame element is incorporated by the lexical units in this frame.</def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition:
<def-root>A modifier expressing the deviation of the <fen>Phenomenon</fen> from the norm or from the value for another <fen>Phenomenon</fen> in terms of how likely the <fen>Phenomenon</fen> would be known.
<ex>It is <fex name="deg">abundantly</fex> <t>obvious</t> you have not a clue how the Retro Program works.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Time</fen> during which the <fen>Phenomenon</fen> is obvious
<ex>It is <t>obvious</t> <fex name="tim">now</fex> that Senator O. T. Tawa has no plan.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Circumstances
FE.definition: <def-root>Some specification of the conditions under which the <fen>Phenomenon</fen> is likely to be known.</def-root>

FE.name: Perceiver
FE.definition:
<def-root>The sentient entity for whom perception or cognition of the <fen>Phenomenon</fen> is judged to be more or less likely.
<ex>It was <t>obvious</t> <fex name="per">to Peter</fex> he had made a wise choice.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Evidence
FE.definition:
<def-root>A state-of-affairs that has a bearing on whether the <fen>Phenomenon</fen> will be perceived or apprehended cognitively. <fen>Evidence</fen> is often metonymically indicated by the mention of an entity whose existence or whose properties are relevant.
<ex>It is usually <t>obvious</t> <fex name="evi">from the context</fex> which meaning is appropriate.</ex>
Some lexical units such as <ment>visible</ment>, <ment>audible</ment> etc. which refer directly to perception in a particular modality incorporate the <fen>Evidence</fen> frame element.</def-root>

FE.name: Group
FE.definition:
<def-root>The likelihood of a <fen>Phenomenon</fen> to be observed perceptually or cognitively in a particular <fen>Group</fen> of comparable background items may be contrasted, implicitly or explicitly, with different groups.
<ex>This correlation was <t>obvious</t> <fex name="gro">in patients classified as acute myeloid leukemia (AML)as well as in the monocytic varieties of ANLL</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Location_of_protagonist
FE.definition:
<def-root>The physical location of a <fen>Perceiver</fen> of the <fen>Phenomenon</fen> or a metaphorical point-of-view location of a cognizer relative to the <fen>Phenomenon</fen>.
<ex>It is <t>obvious</t> <fex name="loc">from here</fex> that the crux of the climb is the ascent up to the southern peak. </ex></def-root>

FE.name: Particular_iteration
FE.definition: <def-root>Expressions marked with this extra-thematic FE modify a non-iterative use of the target, and indicate that it is conceived as embedded within an iterated series of similar events or states. In addition, most expressions of Particular_iteration indicate which instance of the series is being referred to.</def-root>

FE.name: Direction
FE.definition:
<def-root>This frame element is used for all path-like expressions, except those indicating the location of the perceiver (see above), that describe how the perceiver's attention is directed during the act of perception.
<ex>The top of the mountain <t>showed</t> <fex name="Direction">through the mist</fex></ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: obvious.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: easily perceived or understood; clear.

lexUnit.name: manifest.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: clear or obvious to the eye or mind.

lexUnit.name: visible.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: able to be perceived or noticed easily

lexUnit.name: unclear.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: not obvious, definite, or certain.

lexUnit.name: clear.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: such that there is no doubt

lexUnit.name: clarity.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the state or quality of being clear, distinct, and easily perceived or understood.

lexUnit.name: show.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: obvious, apparent, able to be perceived
